trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server can be run in either of the following configurations.

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server can be run in either of the following configurations.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server can be run in either of the following configurations.

trans-unit.source: As <xref format="html" scope="external" href="http://db.apache.org/derby/papers/DerbyTut/ns_intro.html#ns_intro">a stand-alone server</xref>, in which case it is an independent Java process embedding the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine

seg-source.mrk: As <xref format="html" scope="external" href="http://db.apache.org/derby/papers/DerbyTut/ns_intro.html#ns_intro">a stand-alone server</xref>, in which case it is an independent Java process embedding the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine

target.mrk: As <xref format="html" scope="external" href="http://db.apache.org/derby/papers/DerbyTut/ns_intro.html#ns_intro">a stand-alone server</xref>, in which case it is an independent Java process embedding the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine

trans-unit.source: As <xref format="html" scope="external" href="http://db.apache.org/derby/papers/DerbyTut/ns_intro.html#Embedded+Server">an embedded server</xref>, in which case it is embedded within another Java application, and both the Network Server framework and the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine are loaded by the Java application

seg-source.mrk: As <xref format="html" scope="external" href="http://db.apache.org/derby/papers/DerbyTut/ns_intro.html#Embedded+Server">an embedded server</xref>, in which case it is embedded within another Java application, and both the Network Server framework and the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine are loaded by the Java application

target.mrk: As <xref format="html" scope="external" href="http://db.apache.org/derby/papers/DerbyTut/ns_intro.html#Embedded+Server">an embedded server</xref>, in which case it is embedded within another Java application, and both the Network Server framework and the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine are loaded by the Java application

trans-unit.source: You can use Java Management Extensions (JMX) technology to monitor and manage <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> and the Network Server. For information on how to do this, see <xref href="cadminjmxoverview.dita#cadminjmxoverview"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: You can use Java Management Extensions (JMX) technology to monitor and manage <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> and the Network Server.
For information on how to do this, see <xref href="cadminjmxoverview.dita#cadminjmxoverview"></xref>.

target.mrk: You can use Java Management Extensions (JMX) technology to monitor and manage <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> and the Network Server.
For information on how to do this, see <xref href="cadminjmxoverview.dita#cadminjmxoverview"></xref>.

trans-unit.source: You can manage the Network Server by using shell scripts, the command line, or the Network Server API.

seg-source.mrk: You can manage the Network Server by using shell scripts, the command line, or the Network Server API.

target.mrk: You can manage the Network Server by using shell scripts, the command line, or the Network Server API.
